div1.p: Hardy offers a strategy for publicizing the pension campaign.

div1.head: Letter from A.S. Hardy to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 10, 1927
div1.opener:
431-Locust St
Johnson City Tenn-
Aug 10th 1927
Mrs Walter Reed
Summit- Penn-
Dear Madame
div1.p:
I duly read your letter and
copy of Lecture & c all of which greatly
impressed me and others as to the great value
of the labors of Dr. Reed and his Associates

It also impressed us all with the ingratitude
of the Government and the public generally

I gave these papers to Judge Cox to
read- he did so- and his interest and sympathy
were much aroused-saying he would do
whatever was in his power to bring the matter
before the public and before Congress

Judge Cox is Chief Counsel for a
large Manufacture Plant near here-
The Bennbing Rayon, which just at that
time had special need of Judge Cox's close
attention in meeting a sudden emergency
coming upon them He said that as
soon as this matter could be disposed of
- sometime this month probably - that
he would then be glad to help in any
way this good cause that he could

Like him I think a good way
to help along this fine cause is to
have copies of this lecture printed and
sent out by mail to people in other
States and localities asking their aid
in further bringing so good a cause
before the public- thereby getting the
interest and aid of Congress- There is
nothing so interesting to a Congressman as
the voter back home

Judge Cox told me he wanted to
have this lecture to make copies of and
to make some additional explanations
& c of his own added to it

I hope the Judge will soon be able to
attend to this matter- when I will send to
you the copy I now have- as you request

I have many friends in Va California
and at Buffalo and Niagara Falls where
I lived for many years A copy of
the Lecture to many of these would
help this good cause

With great Respect I am
Madam
